relation: I saw campus police every day. They are very present on the campus.
You are getting a great education for being so affordable. You can't hardly find room and board for the amount you pay for classes per semester.
I didn't do much outside of classes with Sinclair, but meeting people in my classes and hanging out with them in between classes was fun.
Food in the cafeteria is good. Each day they have specials so you don't have the same options each day. They have a few sub shops in some buildings that are further away from the main cafeteria.
My classes were challenging, but I walked away learning something from each class. Teachers are available to help for the most part.

Meet with an advisor to schedule your classes, but try to go to the same one each time. There are a lot of advisors, because there are a lot of students, but it is less confusing to stick with the same one.
Sinclair is a great place to start your college career. The classes are affordable and easily fit into your life. I had a great experience at Sinclair.
pageTitle: Sinclair Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {304102=In my opinion, I transferred from another college to Sinclair in September of 2011, and have found that Sinclair has exceeded my speculations in terms of scholastic and performance skills. The Professors at Sinclair are dedicated and willing to help you out in any level of your academic achievement, and will g go out of their way to make sure you truly understand what you are expected to learn in your field, and also in the prerequisite courses. If I were to start all over again, I would do it the same way, making Sinclair my first choice in terms of academic achievement, academic counseling and academic performance., 106492=Sinclair is a diverse, well-established community college that offers a multitude of degrees. They are both regionally and nationally accredited in their nursing program. Best of all, they are converting to semesters starting Fall 2012., 354418=Irish dance competition every year. textAfterTable: Sinclair is a Community College, it offers the cheap tuition but with a fantastic curriculum. Am enjoying being here It is small so you get to know your fellow students. With a small population teachers have time for one on one help and are glad to work with you. Am learning a lot Sinclair offers a broad spectrum of all types of classes and is accredited and ranked as one of the best community colleges in the country. Login to rate or flag the reviews Ann from Huber Heights, OH 06/22/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 104 Categories Comments Great for these types of students It has a great preschool for ages three to five year old's. You can enjoy your classes knowing that your children are taken care of, given meals, and time
